column5: I hear it's a little toasty in TO.  Just to tick y'all off we had record low (62 years) temps early this morning. It was a beautiful 4*C.   :tease: Currently a comfortable 11 degrees.  Remember to bring your pets inside and don't leave the chillin's in da car. Cause they'll melt.
Another idiot in TO left a child in a car yesterday. No cure for stupidity. Keep the pets cool, and that includes the kids.
shut up Dave. ......       .... this heat makes me cranky. I prefer weather where you can wear one of these   At least my beer is cold.
I'll take this over ice and snow any day. my drinks should be at 4 degrees C in July, not the outdoors temps.
Exactly!  Here's some Yellowknife eye candy.
Haha oh man...  Yellowknife : Where the men are men and the women are men

I hope you're enjoying the broken AC at work Borger. I bet those 16 hour shifts in that sweat box are awesome!!!!  FYI, there are some real hotties here in YK. That pic looks more like a Hamiltonian to me.   :tease:
I'm not going to deny it, the last couple of days have been brutal. On the plus side I've lost 10lb's just sitting in my office doing nothing LOL!
Have to agree with this post and the one below it. Summer beats snow and freezing temps 10/10.
I'd take a -20 white out with gale force winds over this crap any day!! Come on fall!!  S.
Mike U R too funny I hate this weather!  I keep cool by remebering last winter sitting on a 5 gallon pail out in the middle of Simcoe or Nipissing!  Sometimes I put a coat on??
It's summertime in Ontario boyz...it gets hot.
You can thank us Americans any time you want. We call it pay-back for the artic blasts you folks send down here each winter. Hope you're all enjoyin' it.

You're all in luck!!! My nice cool weather is set to hit Ontario today and tomorrow. Enjoy the nice cooling torrential rains and scattered tornadoes.  http://www.theweathernetwork.com/news/articles/severe-storms-loom-for-parts-of-ontario-risk-of-brief-tornado/9539/
I hope so Dave, I've got 1500 sq. ft. of new sod that's beginning to look a bit wilted in all this heat and no rain.....well, perhaps we can do without the tornadoes
